SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class StairCommonGoal

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.CommonGoal
it.polimi.ingsw.model.StairCommonGoal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class StairCommonGoal extends CommonGoal implements Serializable
StairCommonGoal is a class that represents a generic CommonGoal which is satisfied if the BookShelf contains a given number of columns of increasing or decreasing height. Starting from the first column on the left or on the right, each next column must be made of exactly one more tile. In the BookShelf, tile can be of any type.
Since:
03/04/2023

Version:
2.0
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

    • rule

      public List<EntryPatternGoal> rule(TileType[][] bookShelf)
      Method that return null if and only if the StairCommonGoal is not satisfied for the bookShelf passes as argument. If the goal is satisfied then the method returns the list of EntryPatterGoal representing the cell in the bookShelf forming the staircase made up of numberOfColumns columns.
      Specified by:
      rule in class CommonGoal
      Parameters:
      bookShelf - Matrix of TileType referring to the player's bookShelf
      Returns:
      null if the bookShelf doesn't satisfy the condition, otherwise the list of EntryPatterGoal that verify the rule of the goal.
      See Also:
      • TileType
      • EntryPatternGoal

    • rightStair

      private List<EntryPatternGoal> rightStair(int startIndexRow, int startIndexColumn, TileType[][] matrix)
      Method that checks if starting from the cell indicated in the matrix there is a staircase from right to left corner (the lowest step of the staircase to the right and the highest one to the left). It returns null if there aren't any groups of tiles forming a staircase pattern, otherwise it returns a list of EntryPatterGoal that forms the staircase in the bookShelf.
      Parameters:
      startIndexRow - Index of the row where the first rung of the stair is positioned
      startIndexColumn - Index of the column where the first rung of the stair is positioned
      matrix - matrix of TileType referring to the player's bookShelf
      Returns:
      null if bookShelf doesn't have a right stair, otherwise the list of EntryPatterGoal that forms the staircase in the bookshelf
      See Also:
      • EntryPatternGoal
      • TileType
      • rule(TileType[][])

    • leftStair

      private List<EntryPatternGoal> leftStair(int startIndexRow, int startIndexColumn, TileType[][] matrix)
      Method that checks if starting from the cell indicated in the matrix there is a staircase from left to right (the lowest step of the staircase to the left and the highest one to the right). It returns null if there aren't any groups of tiles forming a staircase pattern, otherwise it returns a list of EntryPatterGoal that forms the staircase in the bookShelf
      Parameters:
      startIndexRow - Index of the row where the first rung of the stair is positioned
      startIndexColumn - Index of the column where the first rung of the stair is positioned
      matrix - Matrix of TileType referring to the player's bookShelf
      Returns:
      null if bookShelf doesn't have a left stair, otherwise list of EntryPatterGoal that forms the staircase in the bookShelf
      See Also:
      • EntryPatternGoal
      • TileType
      • rule(TileType[][])

    • controlColumn

      private List<EntryPatternGoal> controlColumn(int indexColumn, int indexMinRow, TileType[][] matrix)
      Method that checks if in the indicated column of the matrix, the cell of indexes (indexMinRow, indexColumn) is the first cell having a tile starting from the top downwards. The method returns the list of EntryPatternGoal that satisfy the condition described above is satisfied by the passed parameters.
      Parameters:
      indexColumn - Index of the column which is considered in the matrix
      indexMinRow - Index of the possible highest row containing a tile
      matrix - matrix of TileType referring to the player's bookShelf
      Returns:
      null if the column doesn't satisfy the condition described, otherwise the list of EntryPatterGoal in the given column
      See Also:
      • EntryPatternGoal
      • TileType

    • wellFormedIndex

      private boolean wellFormedIndex(int startIndexRow, int startIndexColumn, TileType[][] matrix)
      Method that return true if and only if a matrix of dimensione numRows*numColumns can contain a staircase made of a given number of columns and having the first rung in the cell of indexes (startIndexRow, startIndexColumn)
      Parameters:
      startIndexRow - index of the row where the first rung of the stair is positioned
      startIndexColumn - index of the column where the first rung of the stair is positioned
      matrix - matrix of TileType referring to the player's bookshelf
      Returns:
      true if and only if the matrix has the right dimension to contain a staircase having the first rung in (startIndexRow, startIndexColumn), false otherwise
      See Also:
      • TileType
